analyzeResult.content:
NEW YORK FORID-TELEGRAM & SUN New York, New York December 6, 1954
Dr. Hockett Joins Tobacco Group
Dr. Robert C. Hockett has been named an associate scien- tific, director of the Tobacco Industry Research Cofn. mittee. it was announced today by Dr. Clarence Cook Little, scientific director.
Dr. Hockett will aid Dr. Little and the Scientific Dr. R. C. Hockett Advisory Board in developing the tobacco industry's program of research into tobacco use and health, it was said. The com- mittee recently made initial grants of $82,000 to six Institu- tions for basic research projects and is reviewing applications for additional grants. Dr. Hock. ett spent nine years prior to 1952 as scientific director of the Sugar Research Foundation.
NEW YORK TIMES New York, New York December 6, 1954
Tobacco Research Aide Named WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UP)- Dr. Robert C. Hockett was ap- pointed today associate scientific director of the Tobacco Industry Research Committee. Dr. Hock- ett, a native of Fayette, Mo., will assist the committee in research in tobacco use and health. Dr. Hockett until recently was a consultant, to Arthur D. Little, Inc., and to pharmaceutical, food and beverage companies. He is a former associate professor of chemistry at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
WALL STREET JOURNAL New York, New York December 7, 1954
Tobacco Industry to Back Study
NEW YORK-The tobacco industry's re- search committee expecta to spend about $60 .- 000 in the first year on a new project it's launching to study human lung ailments.
The committee plans to give a research grant to a group of pathologists to conduct examinations of the bronchial system and the lungs. The data collected will be gathered at a central location for tabulating, comparing and analyzing. The group met here to discuss and plan the program, and will adopt specifie plans at & later meeting.
COR TI 14671

paragraphs.content: NEW YORK FORID-TELEGRAM & SUN New York, New York December 6, 1954
Dr. Robert C. Hockett has been named an associate scien- tific, director of the Tobacco Industry Research Cofn. mittee. it was announced today by Dr. Clarence Cook Little, scientific director.

Dr. Hockett will aid Dr. Little and the Scientific Dr. R. C. Hockett Advisory Board in developing the tobacco industry's program of research into tobacco use and health, it was said. The com- mittee recently made initial grants of $82,000 to six Institu- tions for basic research projects and is reviewing applications for additional grants. Dr. Hock. ett spent nine years prior to 1952 as scientific director of the Sugar Research Foundation.
NEW YORK TIMES New York, New York December 6, 1954

Tobacco Research Aide Named WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UP)- Dr. Robert C. Hockett was ap- pointed today associate scientific director of the Tobacco Industry Research Committee. Dr. Hock- ett, a native of Fayette, Mo., will assist the committee in research in tobacco use and health. Dr. Hockett until recently was a consultant, to Arthur D. Little, Inc., and to pharmaceutical, food and beverage companies. He is a former associate professor of chemistry at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
WALL STREET JOURNAL New York, New York December 7, 1954
NEW YORK-The tobacco industry's re- search committee expecta to spend about $60 .- 000 in the first year on a new project it's launching to study human lung ailments.

The committee plans to give a research grant to a group of pathologists to conduct examinations of the bronchial system and the lungs. The data collected will be gathered at a central location for tabulating, comparing and analyzing. The group met here to discuss and plan the program, and will adopt specifie plans at & later meeting.
